greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n! (mod n^2), that is, n factorial modulo n^2.
comment: With the exception of n=4, if n is composite, a(n) = 0. If n is prime, a(n) = n*(n-1). For example, a(11) = 11*10 = 110, a(41)= 41*40 = 1640. - _Gary Detlefs_, May 01 2010
mathematica: Table[Which[n == 4, Mod[n!, n^2], PrimeQ@ n, n (n - 1), True, 0], {n, 79}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Oct 14 2016 *)
program: (PARI) a(n)=if(isprime(n), n*(n-1), if(n==4, 8, 0)) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Dec 14 2015
results.author: Roman Stawski (roman.stawski(AT)wanadoo.fr), Jul 05 2002
